intro: Centropogon altisilvanus var. minor, commonly known as the lesser mountain piper, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical forests of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Its botanical significance lies in its role within the ecosystem and its potential for horticultural interest.
